fields.description:
This is a feature of Confluence I just noticed, but when you have "..." on a page it replaces it with the single ellipsis character (just like Word does). Neat.

However, it shouldn't do it inside of code blocks. Try this:

{code}
... blah ...
{code}

Notice that the first ... gets replaced, but strangely the second does not. Neither should be replaced, otherwise it messes up formatting.

Are there any other character replacements like this that happen that shouldn't inside of {code}?

Note that the same thing happens with {noformat}.
fields.summary: Ellipsis character incorrectly inserted when using code tag
Incorrect rendering of code tag after a bullet with '|' in the code

fields.description: see attached screenshot. Should display icon instead of text.

fields.description:
The following link (copy/pasted from an address line in FireFox) 

[http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/platform-update-home/dev.html?rev=HEAD&content-type=text/html]

Doesn't work-- The presentation is corrupted and clicking on the link doesn't go to the correct location.

The tilde's are the problem and a workaround is to use %7e instead of ~. 

[http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7echeckout%7e/platform-update-home/dev.html?rev=HEAD&content-type=text/html]

Seems like once I'm in a link  "[http: ..."   then ~ should not be treated specially until the link is closed with "]"
fields.summary: Tilde in http link is not handled correctly

fields.description:
Include a smart queue for indexing calls, decoupled from the generation of the document via the Hibernate session (increases performance by an amazing degree with rules).

Consider config. based sizing limitations on the sizes of the queue; even if they are ridiculously large. It is far better to control the amount of memory which may be taken up here than to open up a black hole.
fields.summary: Lucene indexing queue

fields.description:
This is an i18n issue - basically, whenever we encounter a character outside of the 7 bit clean ASCII range we run into the problem of ensuring that the wider range of UTF-8 characters are correctly handled by browsers, operating systems, etc.. 

For example, currently, if we use 'Löschen in MetaTool' as a title for a page, (which a customer has done), it will often fall into error, depending on the user's environment, when we export the space as zipped HTML.

Charle's idea - create page ids in the export for pages with difficult titles, etc..

This could also be part of a wider range of charset encoding issues which users have raised in regard to saving Russian welcome messages in Confluence, etc..
fields.summary: Page titles may contain characters not permitted by the filesystem, breaking exports

fields.description:
Integration issue: JIRA allows groups with upper casing, Confluence does not. This creates discrepancies between display information, validation routine, and the assignment of permissions.

Remove all lower casing transformations from creative and loading routines - use it for validation alone.

fields.description:
Does anyone have any ideas about how authentication could be done for Jira and Confluence using X.509 digital certificates?  I understand that things can be customized through OSUser but I’m not sure how that would work with digital certificates.  Without a username or password, is OSUser any help?  If so, could Confluence/Jira be modified to remove things like the ability for users to change their password?

 

Any ideas would be greatly appreciated as I’m trying to figure out the best way to integrate these products into an environment that uses X.509 certificates exclusively.

 

Thanks,

Jeff
fields.summary: a store of client X.509 cert.s mapping to OSUser profiles.

fields.description:
We have a long term project ( 7 years ) and several 100M to build a water pipeline. Confluence is being used as the project communication and collaboration tool thus far it has been wildly successful. We recently added scientists and consultants from all over the country to Confluence access via iChain Novell's authentication proxy for http. I have had no problem uploading files internally up to 120M using Confluence upload facilities, however uploads of 1M or greater are failing( 9 out of 10 times sometimes it works!) for our external users accessing Confluence through iChain. Ethereal captures show the multipart post being sent successfully all the way to the server Confluence is running on for both failures and successes. This project must be able to exchange files in a secure manner and project managers have suggested they will pull Confluence support if I don't find a solution to this problem.

Here is my request.
I need to know what classes handle the upload request for attached files. I also need to know how to turn on logging for those files(currently nothing appears in the logs). I need to pinpoint the cause of failure. I do believe the failure is the interaction of iChain with Confluence because neither fails to perform on its own. attached is the error I recieve on screen.
fields.summary: upload failure with iChain

fields.description:
Right now, to retrieve a page via XML-RPC by its title, you need to:

* Retrieve all the pages in the space
* Iterate over each page until you find the one with the title you're after
* Retrieve the page by id

This is a common enough operation that we should have a getPage(token, spaceKey, pageTitle) method.
fields.summary: Retrieve page by space key and page title

fields.description:
While you are able to edit a blog post, it doesnt seem like you are able to view old versions.
I imagine that versioning is there - but not available via UI?

Granted, you are going to edit blog posts that often, but you do want the version history from the point of view of audit. If someone edits a blog post, you want to be able to see what changes they made.
fields.summary: No blog entry versioning?

fields.description:
We've noticed that when we use a page to both display images and offer non-image attachments to download, we find the attachments section becomes very cluttered with a mix of both. Finding the attachment you want becomes a lot harder in these cases.

Would certainly prefer a layout or other UI change that can visually separate out these 2 types of attachments. Maybe by using 2 columns, or using subgroupings with headers.

I realize it's possible to work around this by adding links within the page itself to the _real_ attachments, but we'd prefer to avoid doing that - that's what the attachments section is for.
fields.summary: Organizing images and non-images in attachments section.

fields.description:
Twiki has a useful java drawing applet that lets you create a drawing in a page. It's based on JHotDraw and also allows you to create imagemaps with urls linked to objects in the drawing. More at http://twiki.org/cgi-bin/view/Plugins/TWikiDrawPlugin

Something similar for Confluence would be very useful.
fields.summary: Drawing applet macro

fields.description:
In one of my pages I have this text:

   {noformat}
   .
   c:\work\_common\code\flash
   c:\work\_tools\flash7\classes
   {noformat}

This gets rendered as:

   .
   c:\work_common\code\flash
   c:\work_tools\flash7\classes

Note that the backslashes get missed before the '_' character. I tried escaping the backslash, but then I just get two of them in a row.

Expected behavior: whatever's inside of {noformat} should be reproduced exactly.
fields.summary: Noformat macro should ignore backslashes

fields.description:
Service to allow Confluence to archive emails:

 Zawinski's Law of Software Envelopment:
"Every program attempts to expand until it can read mail. Those programs which cannot so expand are replaced by ones which can."

    *  Periodically check a POP box
    * Incoming mail becomes a content-object
          o parent->child by thread
    * macro to display email stuff
          o {mail:recent=10}
          o {mail:search=Rob|matches=4|summary=true}
    * Intertwingle-like features: http://www.mozilla.org/blue-sky/misc/199805/intertwingle.html
    * Internally name by message-id?
    * Convert mail to page
    * Plugin to filter incoming mail
          o JIRA keys to issue links,
          o filter out spam (spam assassain headers)
          o Link mail subject -> conf page
          o If email exists, set creator to existing user
    * Link to/from/cc to relevant Confluence users
    * Honour spam assassin headers
    * Emails that are replies to outgoing notifications?
    * Mail attachments indexed and stored
fields.summary: Confluence Mail Archive

fields.description: Turadg on conf-user: "Please choose one way to write TrackBack, while you're at it. ;)  On General Configuration they're called "Trackbacks", "TrackBacks" and "trackbacks".  MovableType referes to them uniformly as "TrackBack"."
fields.summary: Make the capitalisation of TrackBack consistent

fields.description: I would like to be able to pull the RSS feed of a particular page in order to feed content of another website. In other words, I have a website where presentation is need in addition to quality content, and I have a number of people who need to update the content on the site. If I could pull an RSS feed of a page directly (or the XML or the HTML of the content only), I could dynamically supply the content via Confluence, and then the other people who might be editors of the content can just go into Confluence to update the website by editing that particular page. Right now, as I understand it, I can only pull RSS feeds of things that have been added or changed - I can't just point to a page and get an RSS feed.
fields.summary: RSS Feeds for Individual Wiki Pages

Upgrade to 0.4. 

We've had a few problems, and the new version adds support for Word 6:

http://www.textmining.org/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=8

We'll also need to add a PDF Extractor which uses PDFBox directly as they have removed support for PDF Box natively in TextMining library.
fields.summary: Library upgrade: TextMining

We really need to upgrade to stable version so that people can get the source.
fields.summary: Library upgrade: WebWork

fields.description:
I searched open issues but this feature request did not immediately pop out, so forgive me if it already exists.

It would be nice to be able to edit pages using a WYSIWYG editor right in the browser. Kind of like Yahoo! and Hotmail when using Windows + IE to compose mail, but instead of HTML it formats the pages Wiki-style.

(I am partial to cross-platform, but who here isn't!)

Ability for news items to expire at a certain date/time

fields.description:
Most other wikis seem to support multi-level numeric lists better than Confluence. In particular, when you use nested # list syntax, I would expect to see the following:

# Topic A
## Sub-Topic B
### Sub-Topic C
## Sub-Topic D

1.0 Topic A
    1.1 Sub-Topic B
        1.1.1 Sub-Topic C
    1.2 Sub-Topic D
fields.summary: Support #.#.# numbering notation for nested lists

fields.description:
In the text for a given page, quite often I refer to the subject of another page more than once. As a result, I use the link syntax for each reference. This allows the reader to jump to that topic from whatever location triggers the need to do so. This works fine.

However, when you follow a link from a page that lists that link multiple times, the destination page shows the linking page multiple times as well. This is unnecessary. As a result for a much-referenced page, the "from" list can be inordinately cluttered.
fields.summary: Only list a referring page once

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to refer to a version of a page.

This would basically be used for meeting notes.
fields.summary: A way to refer to time based revisions

fields.description: It would be great to have a "send this page to someone" icon, so wiki users can easily mail a wiki page to a "friend".
fields.summary: "Send this page to someone" feature

fields.description:
As a team member, I would be interested in being warned of absolutely ALL changes to my team's Confluence space, (as opposed to only page changes), so I can get the full picture on my space every day and act upon changes if needs be.
At the moment Comment changes are not covered, resulting in comments not being replied to because no-one knows they have been posted.

The "Watch this Space" feature kind of covers this need - except that it sends one email per change, which on my space tends to result in spamming...
fields.summary: Daily Change Report  to contain  Comment changes as well as Page changes

fields.description:
Having setup my daily change report notification from the "Edit Profile" page, with the follownig settings:
Type = HTML
Site Hompage = <My own space, ie NOT the dashboard>

... I have found that the email I receive every day contains changes to ALL spaces, as opposed to only mine.

This is a minor nuisance, but still a nuisance.
fields.summary: "Site Homepage" on the Daily Change Report does not result in filtering of reported changes down to the chosen space

fields.summary: Importing from JSPWiki breaks some links

fields.summary: Attached html page with french accents displays chinese caracters

fields.description:
JIRA has great custom fields and workflow capabilities.  If these were ported to Confluence, it could grow beyond being a publishing tool and be programmable to take over in a number of corporate/departmental databases. For example, I'm thinking it could be a great knowledge base...

Workflow would allow for pages in a given space to be "approved" before publishing. Actions on steps might be to change the visibility to more people, change approval assignments, etc. 

Currently each page has a small handful of visible fields: lastChangedOn, lastChangedBy, title, content, and parentPage. Custom fields could augment this and be used for a number of things:
1) additional search capabilities, i.e. keywords
2) macros - i.e. show the results of a search... makes for a nice home page (I used Traction at a previous job, it was quite good at this part)
3) apply templates -- by default, the current template shows the title, lastChangedOn, lastChangedBy, and content. a different template could provide its own content and substitute in the provided variables; the variables themselves could be rich text with their own confluence macros, or could be selected from drop-downs, etc.
fields.summary: custom fields and workflow
